title: Major US Airports Reject DHS Shutdown Video Over Partisan Content
snippets: No fly zone: Airports ground Kristi Noem's government shutdown video Axios
The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, which operates three major airports, said, its "policies prevent airing of politically partisan messages."

Airports in Phoenix, Las Vegas, Seattle and elsewhere cite laws barring partisan political content at TSA checkpoints Several major international US airports, including Phoenix Sky Harbor , Harry Reid international in Las Vegas, Seattle–Tacoma and Charlotte Douglas airport in North Carolina, are opt
The Secretary of Homeland Security filmed a video blaming Democrats for the shutdown impacting TSA operations, but many airports won't play it.
titles: No fly zone: Airports ground Kristi Noem's government shutdown video - Axios
Airports refuse to show DHS Sec. Kristi Noem video blaming Democrats for government shutdown
US airports refuse to air Kristi Noem video blaming Democrats for shutdown
Major airports refuse to play a TSA video of Kristi Noem blaming Democrats for the government shutdown
summary: Several major U.S. airports, including those operated by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, Phoenix Sky Harbor, Harry Reid International in Las Vegas, Seattle–Tacoma, and Charlotte Douglas, have refused to air a government shutdown video by the Secretary of Homeland Security blaming Democrats. The refusal is based on policies and laws against airing politically partisan messages, especially at TSA checkpoints.

title: Ceasefire Holds in Israel-Hamas Conflict; Hostage Remains Returned
snippets: The tenuous ceasefire in the two-year Israel-Hamas war appears to be holding even as complex issues remained ahead.
Israeli officials have voiced anger that only four coffins of Hamas hostages who died in captivity have been returned. The remains have already been identified. DW has more.
The last remaining hostages have been freed from Gaza, including a student, a software tester, a bartender and several soldiers.
We’re tracking what happened to the hostages taken by Hamas on Oct. 7, 2023, from Israel. Dozens were freed or killed, and about 20 are believed to be alive in Gaza.
titles: Questions remain about deceased Israeli hostages in Gaza
Israel frustrated at slow return of deceased hostages
Who are the hostages freed from Gaza?
Hamas took 251 hostages from Israel into Gaza. Where are they?
summary: The ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas conflict is currently holding, despite ongoing complex issues. Israeli officials are upset that only four coffins of hostages who died in Hamas captivity have been returned, with the remains identified. The last hostages, including a student, a software tester, a bartender, and several soldiers, have been freed from Gaza. It is believed that about 20 hostages taken by Hamas on Oct. 7, 2023, are still alive in Gaza.

title: Snell Strikes Out 10, Dodgers Beat Brewers 2-1 in NLCS Game 1
snippets: Blake Snell led the Dodgers to a 2-1 Game 1 victory in the NLCS against the Brewers, pitching his way into the kind of company he knew he'd be keeping when he signed with L.A. before the season.
SI:AM | Flawless Blake Snell Leads Dodgers to Game 1 Win Over Brewers Sports Illustrated
Blake Snell struck out 10 batters and allowed just one hit over eight scoreless innings as the Los Angeles Dodgers topped the Milwaukee Brewers 2-1 in Game 1 of the NLCS.
titles: Larsen-like Snell silences Brewers in Game 1 win
SI:AM | Flawless Blake Snell Leads Dodgers to Game 1 Win Over Brewers - Sports Illustrated
MLB Game 1 Highlights: Dodgers 2, Brewers 1
summary: Blake Snell delivered an outstanding performance for the Los Angeles Dodgers, striking out 10 and allowing only one hit over eight innings, leading the team to a 2-1 victory against the Milwaukee Brewers in Game 1 of the NLCS.

title: Falcons Beat Bills 24-14 in Week 6, Robinson Shines with 170 Yards
snippets: Atlanta secures its biggest win of the young season with strong performances from its skill players.
Highlights from the Week 6 matchup between the Buffalo Bills and the Atlanta Falcons during the 2025 season.

Bijan Robinson matched a career high with 170 rushing yards and gave Atlanta an early two-touchdown lead with the NFL’s longest run of the season, and the Falcons denied Josh Allen’s comeback attempt to beat the Buffalo Bills 24-14 on Monday night.
titles: Bijan Robinson fuels Falcons in MNF win against Bills
Highlights: Robinson has huge game as Falcons stun Bills
Falcons ride Bijan Robinson’s career night to victory over Bills
summary: In a Week 6 game of the 2025 NFL season, the Atlanta Falcons secured a significant victory over the Buffalo Bills with a 24-14 win. Bijan Robinson led the Falcons, matching his career high with 170 rushing yards and scoring two early touchdowns, including the season's longest run. Despite a comeback attempt by Bills' Josh Allen, Atlanta maintained their lead to clinch the win.

title: France Halts Retirement Age Increase to 64 Until 2027 Election
snippets: The changes, which raised the retirement age from 62 to 64, were seen as signature reforms in Emmanuel Macron's presidency.

Sebastien Lecornu said he will freeze France's retirement age at 62, below most comparable countries, until 2027's election. This would leave President Macron unable to implement what he considers a core economic reform.
Sébastien Lecornu hopes concession will suffice to secure left’s support
titles: French PM backs freezing Macron's pension reform to save government
France: PM Lecornu backs suspending Macron's pension reform
French PM to freeze Macron’s pension reform until 2027
summary: France's retirement age will remain at 62 until the 2027 election, as announced by Sebastien Lecornu. This decision halts President Macron's key reform to raise the age to 64. Lecornu aims to gain the left's support with this concession, marking a significant pause in Macron's economic policy plans.

title: Walmart, OpenAI Team Up for AI-Driven Shopping on ChatGPT
snippets: Walmart and OpenAI team up for AI-powered shopping in ChatGPT Axios
The retail giant is trying to keep up with the new ways that shoppers are discovering products.
Walmart Partners With OpenAI to Offer Shopping on ChatGPT Bloomberg.com
titles: Walmart and OpenAI team up for AI-powered shopping in ChatGPT - Axios
Walmart teams up with OpenAI to allow purchases directly in ChatGPT
Walmart Partners With OpenAI to Offer Shopping on ChatGPT - Bloomberg.com
summary: Walmart has partnered with OpenAI to integrate AI-powered shopping into ChatGPT, aiming to modernize how consumers discover products. This collaboration represents Walmart's effort to adapt to evolving shopping behaviors by utilizing advanced AI technology.

title: Cape Verde Qualifies for 2026 World Cup for First Time in History
snippets: The Atlantic island nation erupted with joy after its historic 3–0 home win over Eswatini secured a berth in football's 2026 World Cup across North America.

By blending diaspora players with homegrown talent the island nation of fewer than 600,000 people has qualified for 2026 tournament On 5 July 1975, the Cape Verdean flag was raised for the first time at Estádio da Várzea in the capital city of Praia, marking the nation’s declaration of independence
The tiny African island nation of Cape Verde qualified for the World Cup for the first time on Monday after beating Eswatini 3-0.
titles: Cape Verde celebrates historic first World Cup qualification
‘A defining moment of our nation’: Cape Verde goes wild to celebrate historic World Cup spot
From Iceland to Cape Verde: The smallest countries to reach World Cup
summary: Cape Verde, an Atlantic island nation with a population of fewer than 600,000, celebrated a historic achievement by qualifying for the 2026 World Cup for the first time. This milestone was reached after a 3-0 victory over Eswatini. The team's success is attributed to a blend of diaspora players and local talent. This event marks a significant moment in the nation's sports history since its independence in 1975.

title: Google to Build Largest Non-US AI Data Center in India with $10B Investment
snippets: The new data center in India is set to become the biggest AI hub the tech giant will have anywhere outside of the US.
Google plans to invest $15 billion to build artificial intelligence data center capacity in Southern India, Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian said.
Google Commits More Than $10 Billion to Data Center in India Bloomberg.com
titles: Google to invest $15 billion in India AI data center
Google to invest $15 billion to build data center hub in India; largest outside of the U.S.
Google Commits More Than $10 Billion to Data Center in India - Bloomberg.com
summary: Google is investing over $10 billion to establish the largest artificial intelligence data center outside the US in Southern India, as announced by Google Cloud CEO Thomas Kurian. This initiative aims to significantly expand Google's AI capacity.

title: Supreme Court Upholds $1.4B Libel Judgment Against Alex Jones
snippets: Supreme Court rejects Alex Jones' appeal in Sandy Hook case Axios
The Supreme Court rejected an appeal from Alex Jones, who has been ordered to pay $1.4 billion in damages to the families of victims of the 2012 Sandy Hook shooting.
The judgment against the conservative media commentator is believed to be the largest in American libel history, according to a court filing.
titles: Supreme Court rejects Alex Jones' appeal in Sandy Hook case - Axios
Supreme Court rejects Alex Jones' appeal of $1.4 billion Sandy Hook judgment
Alex Jones’ $1.4 Billion Defamation Loss Stands As Supreme Court Rejects Case
summary: The Supreme Court has declined Alex Jones' appeal, upholding a $1.4 billion libel judgment against him to the Sandy Hook victims' families. This marks the largest libel judgment in U.S. history.

title: Ex-Premier League Referee Pleads Guilty to Making Indecent Child Image
snippets: David Coote was charged on 12 August following an investigation by Nottinghamshire Police.

Ex-official appeared in court over charge relating to a category A video, the most serious kind The former Premier League referee David Coote has pleaded guilty at Nottingham crown court to making an indecent image of a child. The former football official appeared at Nottingham crown court on Tuesda
Sacked Premier League Referee David Coote Pleads Guilty to Making Indecent Video of Child Sports Illustrated
titles: Ex-Premier League referee David Coote admits making indecent image of child
Ex-Premier League referee Coote admits making indecent image of child
Former Premier League referee David Coote admits making indecent image of child
Sacked Premier League Referee David Coote Pleads Guilty to Making Indecent Video of Child - Sports Illustrated
summary: David Coote, a former Premier League referee, pleaded guilty to making an indecent image of a child, classified as category A, the most serious kind. This plea was entered at Nottingham Crown Court following an investigation by Nottinghamshire Police. Coote was charged on August 12 and has since appeared in court, acknowledging his guilt in the case.

title: GM Takes $1.6B Charge, Pivots From All-Electric Goal to Gas, Hybrids
snippets: GM's EV charges comes more than a year after crosstown rival Ford Motor announced a $1.9 billion impact from changing its EV plans.
GM to Take $1.6 Billion Charge on Electric Vehicle Pullback Bloomberg.com
GM previously said it would go all-electric by 2035, but it has scrapped those plans and is now focusing on gas and hybrid cars.
titles: GM to take $1.6 billion charge related to EV pullback
GM to Take $1.6 Billion Charge on Electric Vehicle Pullback - Bloomberg.com
GM is taking a $1.6 billion hit after rolling back its EV plans
summary: GM announced a $1.6 billion charge related to scaling back its electric vehicle (EV) ambitions, shifting focus towards gas and hybrid cars instead of its previous goal of going all-electric by 2035. This move comes over a year after Ford Motor reported a $1.9 billion impact from adjusting its own EV plans.

title: Hamas Releases Hostages in Exchange Deal; Gaza Ceasefire Agreement Signed
snippets: The Israeli military says 20 living hostages have been released by Hamas and have returned to Israel.
Trump and regional leaders sign document to cement Gaza ceasefire deal.
What to know about the 20 living hostages released by Hamas Axios
The last of the 20 remaining living hostages taken by Hamas on Oct. 7, 2023, were returned to Israel on Monday as part of an exchange for Palestinian prisoners held by Israel, Israeli officials said.
titles: Who are the released hostages?
Israel-Gaza: Hostages Returned, Prisoners Released
What to know about the 20 living hostages released by Hamas - Axios
WATCH:  Crowd gathers in Tel Aviv as last of the 20 living hostages released by Hamas
summary: On October 7, 2023, Hamas took 20 hostages, who have now all been released and returned to Israel. This release was part of a prisoner exchange deal for Palestinian detainees held by Israel. Additionally, Trump and regional leaders have signed a document to cement a Gaza ceasefire agreement.

title: Madagascar President Flees Amid Military Revolt, Calls for Dialogue
snippets: Madagascar President Andry Rajoelina called for dialogue "to find a way out of this situation" and said the constitution should be respected.

Andry Rajoelina does not announce resignation in speech broadcast on social media after military rebellion Madagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, said he had fled the country in fear for his life after a military rebellion but did not announce his resignation in a speech broadcast on social media
As part of the takeover, military said that the country’s highest court, the electoral commission and Senate will be dissolved.
The move followed weeks of intense and deadly protests against the government of President Andry Rajoelina, who said he would defy growing calls to resign.
titles: Madagascar's president flees country in fear for his life after military rebellion
Madagascar president says he fled country in fear for his life
Madagascar’s Military Claims Power After President Is Impeached
Madagascar’s President Goes Into Hiding
summary: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina, facing a military rebellion and intense protests, fled the country citing fear for his life but did not resign. In a social media broadcast, he called for dialogue and respect for the constitution. Meanwhile, the military announced plans to dissolve the country's highest court, electoral commission, and Senate amid the crisis.

title: Explosion in Italy Kills 3 Officers, Injures 13; 3 Arrested
snippets: A blast during an eviction near the northern Italian city of Verona has killed three and left 15 others injured. Authorities say the residents had been in financial difficulty and threatened to cause an explosion.

Two men and one woman arrested after explosion in Castel d’Azzano, which police believe to have been intentional An explosion at a farmhouse near Verona killed three police officers and injured at least 13 others, officials said on Tuesday. Police were attempting to conduct an eviction when the hous
The police were carrying out a search warrant at a home whose occupants were resisting eviction, officials said. More than a dozen officers were injured.
titles: Italy: Three police officers killed in house explosion
Three police officers killed in Italy after explosion at house during eviction
Explosion at Italian Farmhouse Kills Three Military Police Officers
summary: An explosion at a farmhouse near Verona, Italy, during an eviction operation killed three police officers and injured at least 13 others. Authorities arrested two men and one woman, believing the explosion was intentional. The incident occurred in Castel d’Azzano as officers were executing a search warrant on residents facing financial difficulties who had threatened to cause an explosion.

title: India to Readmit Canadian Diplomats, Strengthening Ties with Visit from Anand
snippets: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand is in India to discuss a "bilateral relationship" between the two nations amid economic uncertainty and rising geopolitical tensions.

Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand says India has agreed to readmit a full cohort of Canadian diplomats, a year after New Delhi forced Ottawa to send most of its envoys home. Anand met Monday with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and senior Indian officials, who invited her to be the first Canadian ca
titles: India has agreed to readmit Canadian diplomats, Anand says
India has agreed to restore full cohort of Canadian diplomats, Anand says
summary: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand visited India to discuss bilateral relations amid global challenges. During her visit, India agreed to readmit all Canadian diplomats, reversing last year's decision to expel most. Anand met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and senior officials, marking a significant step in restoring diplomatic ties between Canada and India.

title: Brewers Execute Historic 8-6-2 Double Play in NLCS Game 1 Against Dodgers
snippets: The Brewers pulled off the first 8-6-2 double play in MLB postseason history against the Dodgers in Game 1 of the NLCS on Monday night.
Watch as the Milwaukee Brewers turn an insane double play to keep the Dodgers from opening the scoring in Game 1 of the NLCS.

Max Muncy came within inches of hitting a grand slam for the Los Angeles Dodgers to open the scoring in the National League Championship Series. Instead, the Milwaukee Brewers turned it into one of the most incredible double plays in post-season history.
titles: Brewers turn MLB's 1st playoff 8-6-2 double play
Brewers turn insane double play to keep game tied vs. Dodgers
Brewers turn potential grand slam into wild double play vs. Dodgers
summary: In Game 1 of the NLCS, the Milwaukee Brewers executed the first 8-6-2 double play in MLB postseason history against the Los Angeles Dodgers, preventing the Dodgers from scoring. This remarkable play occurred after Max Muncy nearly hit a grand slam, showcasing an extraordinary defensive effort by the Brewers.

title: Jake Moody Steps Up for Bears in Santos' Absence, Delivers Clutch Performance
snippets: With Cairo Santos sidelined, Moody was activated before the game and came up big when it mattered most.
Jake Moody was clutch for the Bears, and it wasn't something he expected to come.

Bears' Jake Moody shares unlikely story behind his game-winning field goal
summary: Jake Moody was activated for the Bears game due to Cairo Santos being sidelined. In his unexpected role, Moody delivered a clutch performance, significantly contributing to the team's efforts.

title: Titans Fire Brian Callahan as Head Coach After 4-19 Record
snippets: The Titans have fired Brian Callahan just six games into his second season as the team's head coach. He finishes with a 4-19 record as the team's coach.
Brian Callahan is the first NFL head coach to get pink-slipped this season and chances are he’ll have some company in the unemployment line in the not-too-distant future.
titles: Titans fire Callahan, to give McCoy shot at job
Other coaches on hot seat after Titans fire Callahan
summary: The Titans have dismissed Brian Callahan from his position as head coach after only six games into his second season, concluding his tenure with a 4-19 record. Callahan is the first NFL head coach to be fired this season.

title: Former DII Backup Chambliss Becomes Key Player for Ole Miss
snippets: Part Cam Ward, part Baker Mayfield? Trinidad Chambliss became an SEC sensation seemingly overnight.
Chambliss, who went from D-II backup to SEC star in a year, leads Ole Miss into Georgia on Saturday
titles: 'Trinidad Magic': Meet the Ole Miss breakout QB even his teammates hadn't heard of
The people and places that made Trinidad Chambliss, Ole Miss' breakout star QB living his dreams in the SEC
summary: Trinidad Chambliss, formerly a Division II backup, has rapidly risen to prominence in the SEC, becoming a key player for Ole Miss. His unexpected ascent has drawn comparisons to athletes like Cam Ward and Baker Mayfield. Chambliss is set to lead Ole Miss against Georgia in an upcoming Saturday game, marking a significant moment in his college football career.

title: Oracle to Deploy 50,000 AMD GPUs for AI in 2026 After OpenAI Deal
snippets: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure on Tuesday announced that it will deploy 50,000 Advanced Micro Devices graphics processors starting in the second half of 2026.
AMD reached a multibillion-dollar deal earlier this month with OpenAI, matching a growing demand for AI infrastructure.
titles: Oracle Cloud to deploy 50,000 AMD AI chips, signaling new Nvidia competition
Oracle Will Deploy AMD’s AI Chips—Challenging Nvidia
summary: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure plans to deploy 50,000 AMD graphics processors starting in the second half of 2026, following a multibillion-dollar deal between AMD and OpenAI aimed at meeting the rising demand for AI infrastructure.

title: USC Study Reveals Brain Vessel Aging and Pain Modulation Breakthroughs
snippets: Researchers at USC have created the first method to noninvasively measure microscopic blood vessel pulses in the human brain. Using advanced 7T MRI, they found these tiny pulsations grow stronger with age and vascular risk, disrupting the brain’s waste-clearing systems. The discovery may explain how

Researchers have found a set of brainstem neurons that can dial down chronic pain. These Y1 receptor neurons balance pain with other vital needs like hunger and fear, showing that the brain can override suffering when survival is at stake. The discovery could transform how chronic pain is understood
titles: Scientists find the brain’s hidden pulse that may predict Alzheimer’s
Scientists Uncover the Brain’s Hidden Pain Switch
summary: Researchers at USC have developed a noninvasive technique using 7T MRI to measure microscopic blood vessel pulses in the brain, discovering these pulses intensify with age and vascular risk, potentially affecting the brain's waste-clearing systems. Separately, a discovery of brainstem neurons with Y1 receptors has revealed the ability of the brain to modulate chronic pain in favor of survival needs such as hunger and fear. These findings could significantly impact the understanding and treatment of brain health and chronic pain.

Rare Earth Stocks Decline As US-China Trade Tensions Persist
summary: European stocks fell due to renewed concerns over US-China tariffs, while rare earth stocks surged amid escalating tensions. China, the world's largest rare earth exporter, has increased export controls.

title: Communities Secretary Criticizes Women's Exclusion from London Charity Run
snippets: Steve Reed said he was "horrified" that women were barred from mosque-run London charity event.

Event in Victoria Park organised by East London mosque and London Muslim Centre was open to ‘men, boys of all ages and girls under 12’ The communities secretary has said it was “absolutely unacceptable” for women to be excluded from taking part in a Muslim charity run in London. The event on Sunday,
titles: Minister 'appalled' women banned from Muslim run
Minister ‘appalled’ at Muslim charity run in London that excluded women
summary: Communities Secretary Steve Reed expressed dismay over women being excluded from a charity run in London's Victoria Park, organized by East London Mosque and London Muslim Centre. The event was open only to men, boys of all ages, and girls under 12. Reed labeled the exclusion of women as "absolutely unacceptable."

Fayaz Khan, 26, was also sentenced at Southwark crown court for entering the UK illegally on a small boat A man who threatened on TikTok to kill the Reform UK leader, Nigel Farage, has been jailed for five years. Fayaz Khan, an Afghan national whose real name is believed to be Fayaz Husseini, made t
titles: Man jailed for five years for threatening to kill Nigel Farage
Afghan man jailed for five years for TikTok threat to kill Nigel Farage
summary: Fayaz Khan, 26, was sentenced to five years in jail for threatening to kill Reform UK leader Nigel Farage in a TikTok video. Khan, an Afghan national also known as Fayaz Husseini, entered the UK illegally. The threats were described by Farage as "pretty chilling."

title: SpaceX's Starship Completes Major Test Flight, Circling Half the Globe
snippets: Starship, the biggest and most powerful rocket ever built, thundered into the evening sky from the southern tip of Texas.
SpaceX launched another of its mammoth Starship rockets on a test flight Monday, successfully making it halfway around the world.
titles: SpaceX launches 11th test flight of its mega Starship rocket with another win
WATCH:  SpaceX launches 11th test flight of Starship mega rocket
summary: SpaceX successfully launched its massive Starship rocket from Texas, marking a significant test flight that saw the vehicle travel halfway around the world. This achievement underscores SpaceX's progress in developing the largest and most powerful rocket to date.
